snippet: Dasani is one of more than 22,000 homeless children in New York City. The New York Times began following her in September 2012, when she was 11 years old and living at the Auburn Family Residence in Brooklyn.
abstract: Profile of Dasani, 11-year-old girl who is one of more than 22,000 homeless children in New York City, the highest number since the Great Depression; Dasani has endured squalid and dangerous conditions with her parents and seven siblings in a tiny room at the Auburn Family Residence in Fort Greene, Brooklyn (Series: Invisible Child).

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rebecca R. Ruiz and Joseph Goldstein, and research by Ms. Ruiz, Joseph Burgess, Alain Delaquérière and Ramsey Merritt.

lead_paragraph: Dasani is one of more than 22,000 homeless children in New York City. The New York Times began following her in September 2012, when she was 11 years old and living at the Auburn Family Residence in Brooklyn.

headline.main: Girl in the Shadows: Dasani’s Homeless Life
headline.print_headline: Girl in the Shadows: Dasani’s Homeless Life
